{"step_by_step_thinking": "Non immune hydrops refers to the accumulation of fluid in at least two fetal compartments, such as the skin, pleural space, pericardium, or abdomen. It is usually caused by underlying fetal abnormalities. Skin edema, ascites, and cardiomegaly are commonly seen in non immune hydrops. However, a large placenta is not typically associated with non immune hydrops.", "answer_choice": "C"}
